intro: Stenodraba vestita, commonly known as the velvet-headed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring well-drained environments. Its small, pinkish to white flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is known for its hardy, drought-resistant nature. Stenodraba vestita is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions.
